main event: On 15 September 1959, the Pittsburgh police investigated a reported explosion in the Frick Park area, leading to the discovery of an unidentified object.
interesting points: The object was conically shaped, made of yellow polyethylene plastic, and weighed approximately twelve pounds., Police were first notified of an explosion in the area on 9 July 1959., The object contained various internal components including a light bulb, battery, and transformer, but no connections to a functional device were found., Investigators concluded the object was likely a prank or a school experiment given its crude design and lack of purpose., No evidence supported that the object was airborne or had any relationship with weather balloons despite initial assumptions.
sighted object: a conically shaped object with a red light and various internal components
witness description: Pittsburgh police officers and airport control tower operators
